newsitem.title: USA: TYCO buys three metal makers, two in U.K..
newsitem.headline: TYCO buys three metal makers, two in U.K..

text.p: Tyco International Ltd said Thursday the acquisition of three privately held metal and framing makers in a cash deal.
The three companies are: T.J. Cope, headquartered in Collegeville, Penn.; Unistrut-Europe in Bedford, England, and Steel Support Systems in Birmingham, England.
"They (the acquisitions) compliment one another and give us product breath," said David Brownell, vice president of the Exeter-based diversified maker of industrial and commerical products.

Asked if Tyco intended to restructure the companies, Brownell said replied no and instead the purchases would "give us a broader scope and better coverage" of the metal framing and support systems market which he estimated to be $500 million worldwide.
Tyco which operates in more than 50 countries has revenues in excess of $6 billion. While the terms of the acquisitions were not disclosed, Brownell said they were all cash transactions.
